DescriptionParser

Summary
DescriptionParser
ExtensionTag
Describes Extension tags for the form description parser.
Functions
parse
Parses the extension tag.
getHTMLNodes
Returns an array with the single HTML nodes that should replace the template tags.

Specifies the placeholder tag names in the template for this tag.
getExtraTemplateTags
Returns extra template tagnames that are used by this extension tag.
getID
Returns the id of the tag.
wrapHTML
Called after templates have been applied.
DescParser
The form description parser.
Properties
Property: $descriptions An array of all the descriptions in the file
$templateParser
An instance of a TemplateParser for the specified template
$templateTags
An array of all the placeholder tags for all the templates specified by Extension tags.
$usedIDs
An array of all IDs that are used within a single form description.
$obj
An Object instance made from this file’s Object description.
$extensions
An array with classnames of Extension tags.
Parse state
Properties that contain state that needs to be kept during parsing.
$selectString
The string against which Selectors are matched.
$inputLinks
Holds a map from object property ids to HTMLInput nodes that modify these properties.
$openInputs
Contains a list of HTMLInput tags that have not been assigned an error position yet.
$errorFlags
An array of all error flag names Collected in a post-parsing step.
$idToInput
A map from input ids to their actual HTMLInput nodes.
$submits
A map from submit ids to the name of their actions.

ExtensionTag

Describes Extension tags for the form description parser.  Extend this class and implement the abstract functions (and override the nonabstracts if necessary) to define new tag functionality.  Also register the new tag with DescParser::registerExtension.

Summary
Functions
parse
Parses the extension tag.
getHTMLNodes
Returns an array with the single HTML nodes that should replace the template tags.
getTemplateTagnames
Specifies the placeholder tag names in the template for this tag.
getExtraTemplateTags
Returns extra template tagnames that are used by this extension tag.
getID
Returns the id of the tag.
wrapHTML
Called after templates have been applied.

Functions

parse

abstract public function parse(DOMElement $node,
DescParser &$parser)

Parses the extension tag.

Parameters

$nodea DOMElement of the tag.
$parseran instance of the DescParser that has found this tag.

This function is responsible for parsing the extension tag.  It can use the <DescParser::Parser support> functions for some common functionality, such as parsing free HTML content contained within a subtag.

Note that this function does not return anything.

getHTMLNodes

abstract public function getHTMLNodes()

Returns an array with the single HTML nodes that should replace the template tags.  Key indices are the names from getTemplateTagnames.

Returns

The described array, unless the result of getTemplateTagnames is false, then it returns a single HTML node.

getTemplateTagnames

abstract public function getTemplateTagnames()

Specifies the placeholder tag names in the template for this tag.

Returns

An array of strings, specifying the names of tag at which point HTML should be inserted.  Can also return false, this indicates that no template is used.

getExtraTemplateTags

public function getExtraTemplateTags()

Returns extra template tagnames that are used by this extension tag.  Normally, only a template with the same name as the extension tag is defined by an extension.  Some extensions may need more templates, so they can specify the names and placeholder tags through this function.

Returns

An array where the keys are template names, and the values arrays with placeholder tag names.

getID

public function getID(DOMElement $node)

Returns the id of the tag.

Some extension tags may use other attributes to determine their ids (An example is the field tag, which may use the attribute property).  If other attributes are used, override this method to return the id of an extension tag.

Parameters

$nodeThe node to determine the id of

Returns

The id of the node, or false if this node does not have an id, or it uses the id attribute for ids.

wrapHTML

public function wrapHTML(HTMLNode $html)

Called after templates have been applied.  This function allows the extension tag to modify HTML tags that are part of the applied template.

Parameters

$htmlA HTMLNode representing the generated html.

Returns

The replacement html.

DescParser

The form description parser.  This parser parses Form descriptions.

Summary
Properties
Property: $descriptions An array of all the descriptions in the file
$templateParser
An instance of a TemplateParser for the specified template
$templateTags
An array of all the placeholder tags for all the templates specified by Extension tags.
$usedIDs
An array of all IDs that are used within a single form description.
$obj
An Object instance made from this file’s Object description.
$extensions
An array with classnames of Extension tags.
Parse state
Properties that contain state that needs to be kept during parsing.
$selectString
The string against which Selectors are matched.
$inputLinks
Holds a map from object property ids to HTMLInput nodes that modify these properties.
$openInputs
Contains a list of HTMLInput tags that have not been assigned an error position yet.
$errorFlags
An array of all error flag names Collected in a post-parsing step.
$idToInput
A map from input ids to their actual HTMLInput nodes.
$submits
A map from submit ids to the name of their actions.
Functions
__construct
Creates a new DescParser.
registerExtension
Registers an extension tag.
setFile
Specifies a Form description file from which form descriptions should be fetched.
parseObjectDescription
Parses the Object description in the file.
getObjectDescription
Returns the Object description of the form.
getDescribedForms
Returns an array with the names of the form descriptions contained in the file.
getFormDescription
Returns the data for one single form description.
getIDs
Returns a list of all ids used in the given node and its subnodes.
inheritDesc
Create a form description by inheriting another description.
getInputs
Retrieves a list of all HTMLInput nodes under a given node.
processErrorMsg
Replaces ErrorPlaceholders with actual HTML nodes.
parseHTML
Parses a DOMNode into a HTMLNode.
Parsing support
Functions exposed for the convenience of extension tags
ensureUnused
Throws an exception if the given id is already used.
addID
Adds an id to the list of used ids
getProperty
Returns the Property for a given name.
linkInputToProperty
Indicates that a given property is manipulated by a given input.
applyTemplate
Applies a template.
getInput
Retrieves a named input node.

Properties

Property: $descriptions An array of all the descriptions in the file

$templateParser

An instance of a TemplateParser for the specified template

$templateTags

An array of all the placeholder tags for all the templates specified by Extension tags.

$usedIDs

An array of all IDs that are used within a single form description.  Used to determine if an id has already been used.

$obj

An Object instance made from this file’s Object description.

$extensions

An array with classnames of Extension tags.

Parse state

Properties that contain state that needs to be kept during parsing.

$selectString

The string against which Selectors are matched.  This string basically represents the hierarchy of nodes we visited to get here, with the tag names separated by spaces.  It always starts with a space.

$inputLinks

Holds a map from object property ids to HTMLInput nodes that modify these properties.

$openInputs

Contains a list of HTMLInput tags that have not been assigned an error position yet.  This is used in a post-parsing step that assigns inputs to an error positions.

$errorFlags

An array of all error flag names Collected in a post-parsing step.

$idToInput

A map from input ids to their actual HTMLInput nodes.

$submits

A map from submit ids to the name of their actions.

Functions

__construct

public function __construct()

Creates a new DescParser.

Initializing a DescParser consists of including all extension .php files in a few subdirectories:

Extensions/Extension tags
Checks/Checks
Inputs/Inputs

It then initializes $templateTags.

registerExtension

public static function registerExtension($tagname,
$classname)

Registers an extension tag.

Parameters

$tagnameThe name of the tag.
$classnameThe name of the class that processes the given tag.

setFile

public function setFile($filename)

Specifies a Form description file from which form descriptions should be fetched.

Parameters

$filenameThe filename to parse.

parseObjectDescription

protected function parseObjectDescription()

Parses the Object description in the file.

Returns

An Object parsed from the XML’s object tag.

getObjectDescription

public function getObjectDescription()

Returns the Object description of the form.

getDescribedForms

public function getDescribedForms()

Returns an array with the names of the form descriptions contained in the file.

getFormDescription

public function getFormDescription($formID)

Returns the data for one single form description.

Parameters

$formIDThe name of the form to retrieve.

Returns

An array with the following keys:

htmlThe HTMLNodes describing the form’s html.
errorflagsA list of all the names of error flags used in the form.
inputLinksA map from object property ids to inputs using those IDs.
submitsA list of all submit buttons giving the action for each submit.

getIDs

protected function getIDs(DOMNode $node)

Returns a list of all ids used in the given node and its subnodes.

Parameters

$nodeThe node to retrieve ids from.

Returns

An array of ids.

inheritDesc

protected function inheritDesc(DOMNode $source,
DOMNode $desc)

Create a form description by inheriting another description.

Parameters

$sourceThe node to inherit
$descThe node that describes the modifications to the source node.

Returns

A DOMNode that contains the merged form description.

getInputs

protected function getInputs(HTMLNode $node)

Retrieves a list of all HTMLInput nodes under a given node.

Parameters

$nodeThe node to gather inputs from.

Returns

A map from input names to their nodes.

Note

This function also fills the $submits array.

processErrorMsg

protected function processErrorMsg(HTMLNode $node)

Replaces ErrorPlaceholders with actual HTML nodes.  This function keeps a list of input tags that have not been assigned an error message position.  As soon as a placeholder is encountered, the error messages for the open inputs are placed at that point and the list is cleared.

Parameters

$nodeThe node to process

parseHTML

public function parseHTML(DOMNode $node)

Parses a DOMNode into a HTMLNode.  This implementation does not call its parent’s parseHTML.

Handled by this implementation

  • if attribute
  • ondisable attribute
  • errormsg tags
  • Extension tags
  • templating of normal tags

Parsing support

Functions exposed for the convenience of extension tags

ensureUnused

public function ensureUnused($id)

Throws an exception if the given id is already used.

Parameters

$idThe id to ensure uniqueness for

addID

public function addID($id)

Adds an id to the list of used ids

Parameters

$idThe id to add

getProperty

public function getProperty($id)

Returns the Property for a given name.

Paramters

$idThe name of the property to retrieve.

linkInputToProperty

public function linkInputToProperty($inputID,
$propertyID)

Indicates that a given property is manipulated by a given input.

Parameters

$inputIDThe name of the input
$propertyIDThe name of the property

applyTemplate

public function applyTemplate($nodeName,
$tplNodes,
$singleRoot)

Applies a template.  This is a wrapper around TemplateParser::applyTemplate, filling in a few values that extension tags do not know.  Otherwise it functions the same.

Parameters

$nodenameThe tag name within the form template to use
$tplNodesAn array, with the keys being the names of placeholder tags and their values a single tag that will replace the named placeholder tag.
$singleRootIndicates that the result should have a single root.  This is required for example when the placeholder tag had attributes.

Returns

See TemplateParser::applyTemplate.

getInput

public function getInput($id)

Retrieves a named input node.

Parameters

$idThe name of the input to retrieve

Returns

A HTMLInput.

Parses Form templates.
Contains an Object description.
The object description describes the object the forms are managing.
To allow different templates for the same tag in different situations, a selector can be specified for a template.
Base class for html inputs.
